meanings.definition: A territory or jurisdiction of a palatine.
meanings.sent1: The palatinates were ruled by a palatine lord.
meanings.sent2: The king granted the palatinates to his loyal nobleman.
meanings.sent3: The neighboring palatinates often had friendly competitions.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, each palatinate represented a different power.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the palatinates' landscapes was truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The office or rank of a palatine.
meanings.sent1: She aspired to hold the prestigious palatinates in the royal court.
meanings.sent2: The duties of the palatinates included overseeing legal matters.
meanings.sent3: The palatinates' daily tasks kept them busy and fulfilled.
meanings.sent4: His authority as the palatinates was unquestionable among the courtiers.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the palatinates' ceremonies impressed all who attended.

meanings.sent1: The palatinates were known for their fair and just rulers.
meanings.sent2: The young prince inherited the title of palatinates after his father.
meanings.sent3: The palatinates' lavish banquets were the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The palatinates' influence extended far beyond their borders.
meanings.sent5: The palatinates' castle stood proudly on the hill, overlooking the valley.
